custom_fields.key_topics: The course is meant to assist you in understanding the logic behind solving a Rubik's Cube and perhaps come up with your own solution to solve it. This course is not meant to teach you how to fix a Rubik's Cube by spoon feeding you an algorithm nor is it about speed cubing. It is meant to teach you useful principles that can be used to help you solve the cube on your own.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will be two major assessments. A reflection needs to be written for what you learned from the 2x2 and another reflection for the 3x3.
custom_fields.goals: Have a better understanding on twisty puzzles such as the Rubiks Cube and how to begin to solve one. Identify principles that can be helpful in solving the Rubiks Cube. Come up with your own approach to solving the Rubiks Cube. Have an intuitive understanding as to how the Rubiks Cube can be solved.
custom_fields.relevance: It will help strengthen problem solving skills in students. This is particularly relevant to CS majors.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The Pyramix, 2x2 Rubik's Cube, and 3x3 Rubik's Cube will be provided to students.

long_desc: The course is meant to assist you in understanding the logic behind solving a Rubiks Cube and perhaps come up with your own solution to solve it. This course is not meant to teach you how to fix a Rubiks Cube by spoon feeding you an algorithm nor is it about speed cubing. It is meant to teach you useful principles that can be used to help you solve the cube on your own.
name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Understanding the Rubik's Cube
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Understanding the Rubik's Cube
